orl_sentence: When we read books we seem to enter a new world . This new world can be similar to the one we are living in , or it can be very [MASK] .
Some stories are told as if they were true . Real people who live in a [MASK] world do real things ; in other words , the stories are about people just like us doing what we do .
Other stories , such as the Harry Potter books , are not [MASK] .

They are characters and creatures that are very different from us and do things that would be impossible for us . But there is more to books and writing than this . If we think about it , even realistic writing is only [MASK] .

How can we tell the difference between what is real and what is not real ? For example , when we read about Harry Potter , we do seem to learn something about the real world . And when Harry studies magic at Hogwarts , he also learns more about his real life than [MASK] .

Reading , like writing , is an action . It is a way of thinking . When we read or write something , we do much more than simple look at words on a page . We use our [MASK] , which is real , and our imagination , which is real in a different way , to make the words come to life in our minds .

Both realism and use the imagination and the magic of reading and writing to make us think . When we read something realistic , we have to [MASK] that the people we are reading about are just like us , even though we know that we are real and they are not .

Both realism and use the imagination and the magic of reading and writing to make us think . When we read something realistic , we have to imagine that the people we are reading about are just like us , even though we [MASK] that we are real and they are not .
It sounds [MASK] , but it works .
When we read , we fill in missing information and think about the causes and effects of what a character does . We help the writer by [MASK] that what we read is like real life .
In a way , we are writing the book , too . Most of us probably don't think about what is going on in our [MASK] when we are reading .
We pick up a book and lose ourselves in a good story , eager to find out what will [MASK] next .
Knowing how we feel when we read can help us become better [MASK] , and it will help us discover more about the real magic of books .

A young man was getting ready to graduate from college . For many months he had loved a beautiful sports car in a dealer's showroom , and knowing his father could well [MASK] it , he told him that was all he wanted .
As graduation day drew near , the young man expected [MASK] that his father had bought the car .
Finally , on the morning of the special day , his father called him into his study . His father told him how [MASK] he was to have such a fine son , and how much he loved him .
He handed his son a beautiful wrapped gift box . Curious , but a little bit [MASK] , the young man opened the box and found a lovely Bible .
Angrily , he raised his [MASK] to his father and said , Is a Bible all you can give me with all your money ?

He then stormed out of the house , leaving the Bible . Many years [MASK] and the young man was very successful in business , but realizing his father was very old , he thought perhaps he should go to see him .

He then stormed out of the house , leaving the Bible . Many years passed and the young man was very successful in business , but [MASK] his father was very old , he thought perhaps he should go to see him .

He then stormed out of the house , leaving the Bible . Many years passed and the young man was very successful in business , but realizing his father was very old , he thought perhaps he [MASK] go to see him .
He had not seen him since that graduation day . [MASK] he could make the arrangements , he received a telegram which informed him of his father's death , and all the possessions willed to him .
He had not seen him since that graduation day . Before he could make the arrangements , he received a telegram which [MASK] him of his father's death , and all the possessions willed to him .
[MASK] arriving at his father's house , sudden sadness and regret filled his heart .
He began to [MASK] through his father's important papers and saw the still new Bible , just as he had left it years ago .
He began to search through his father's important papers and saw the still new Bible , just as he had [MASK] it years ago .
With tears , he opened the Bible and began to turn over . As he was reading , a car [MASK] dropped from the back of the Bible .
How many times do we [MASK] blessings because they are not wrapped as we expected ?
Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not ; but remember what you now have was once [MASK] the things you hoped for .
What may appear as bad fortune may [MASK] be the door that is just waiting to be opened .

At 1 : 30 p . m . on March 31 , 1981 , John Hinckley Jr . stepped from a crowd of onlookers and tried to kill Ronald Reagan , the president of the United States . Although he failed , he did cause injury to the president . The crime was committed in clear view of many people . [MASK] , at the end of his trial , Hinckley was found not guilty by reason of insanity .

At 1 : 30 p . m . on March 31 , 1981 , John Hinckley Jr . stepped from a crowd of onlookers and tried to kill Ronald Reagan , the president of the United States . Although he failed , he did cause injury to the president . The crime was committed in clear view of many people . However , at the end of his trial , Hinckley was found not [MASK] by reason of insanity .

Instead of prison , Hinckley was sent to a mental hospital , where he remains . The judgment in Hinckley's case did more than annoy a few people . It kicked off a nationwide debate about whether people accused of a crime can claim they were insane when they did it . If they were capable of [MASK] and then committing a crime , how could they later claim to have been insane ?

One starting point is to identify what insane means in a U . S . court of law . Very young children cannot be [MASK] if they do not know right from wrong , because they cannot be held morally responsible for their actions .

For most people , moral responsibility comes with age and maturity . Psychologists , however , say that there are some adults who cannot recognize right from wrong . Since these adults cannot tell the [MASK] , they should not be held morally responsible for their actions .

In a U . S . court of law , an adult like this may be considered insane . Hinckley was judged insane because [MASK] determined that his mind was not functioning like a(n) normal adult's so he had no idea what he was doing .

In a U . S . court of law , an adult like this may be considered insane . Hinckley was judged insane because psychologists determined that his mind was not functioning like a(n) [MASK] adult's so he had no idea what he was doing .

Instead of spending the rest of his life in prison , Hinckley would be committed to a mental hospital , where he could be treated for his illness . People who are against the use of an insanity defense say that criminals like Hinckley do know what they are doing . [MASK] of the insanity defense say that everyone who commits a serous crime like Hinckley's could be said to be mentally ill .

Otherwise , the person would not commit the crime in the first place . There are many people who struggle with severe mental illness who do not commit crimes . The illnesses should not be used as a(n) [MASK] for violent behavior .
People who [MASK] the insanity defense believe that mental illnesses are not always treatable .
Psychologists have been able to detect patterns of behavior . These mental detectives have [MASK] evidence that a person can be insane but seem normal .
Hinckley and others with [MASK] conditions suffer from delusions .

Even though people with delusions may seem normal , the world does not appear to them as it does to other people . Therefore , experts say , such people cannot be held to the rules of behavior other people are held to . Their punishments should be [MASK] .
Once upon a time a teacher and his student [MASK] down under a big tree near the big grass area .
Then suddenly the student asked the teacher , Teacher , I'm puzzled . How do we [MASK] our soul mate ?
Could you please help me ? Silent for a few seconds , the teacher then answered , Well , it's a pretty hard and easy question . The teacher [MASK] , Look that way .
There is a lot of grass . Why don't you walk there ? But please don't walk [MASK] .
On your way , try to find a blade of beautiful grass and [MASK] it and then give it to me .

But just one . The student said OK and then he walked straight ahead to the grassy field . A few minutes later , the student came back empty-handed . When the teacher asked the reason , the student said , On my journey , I found quite a few beautiful blades of grass , but I [MASK] that I would find a better one , so I didn't pick it .
But I didn't realize that I was at the [MASK] of the field , and I hadn't picked any because you told me not to go back , so I didn't go back .
Hearing this , the teacher said , That's what will happen in real life . What is the [MASK] of this story ?
In the story , grass is the people around you ; the beautiful blade grass is the people that [MASK] you and the grassy field is time .
In looking for your soul mate , please don't always [MASK] and hope that there will be a better one .
By doing that , you'll [MASK] your lifetime .
